Transferred_Post:
"Cough drops taste gross because I have a refined palate and can't stand cheap, artificial flavors."

However, it's important to note that this statement still attributes the cause of the dislike of cough drops to a stable factor (having a refined palate). It might be more effective to rephrase it in a way that focuses on temporary or unstable factors. For example:

Transferred Post: "I'm not enjoying the taste of these cough drops right now. Maybe it's because I've been eating too much sugar lately and my taste buds are a bit burned out."

This revised statement shifts the focus away from a stable attribute (having a refined palate) and instead attributes the dislike of cough drops to a temporary factor (eating too much sugar). This can help to reduce the likelihood of depressive symptoms resulting from the experience.
